The NC Broadband Infrastructure Office (in cooperation with the Friday Institute at NC State) has developed a tool to allow residents to test and report their home internet connection speed. This tool is not intended for students but would be appropriate to share with employees and parents. Users are asked to provide their address so that the demand can be aggregated and targeted for investment through policy and grant programs. For parents and staff that have no internet access, they may call or text a phone number and have their location added to the database. Exact addresses will not be published. Email addresses are not collected. Users are asked to answer a few quick questions and presented with a 30 second speed test.

Complete details are here:
https://ncbroadband.gov/survey

We will play the song Dark Horses by Switchfoot on the Football and Soccer speakers

Traffic will move in one direction

Turn left at the Football concessions and go behind Dark Horse Stadium.
Then travel past the softball, band and soccer fields.
Vehicles will exit right onto Indian Town road.

No one should be entering from the opposite direction or turning around during the event.

Everyone participating should remain in their vehicles and drive with caution (Safety First)

Please come out and show you support for our Senior class of 2020!!!

February 10 at 11:16 PM ¬∑

Union Middle School visited Sampson Middle School tonight for the semifinal round of the Sampson County Middle School conference tournament. A much improved Union squad led 14-12 at the end of the first quarter. But the the Dark Horse pressure defense took over as the horses out scored the Spartans 55 to 18 over the next three quarters to take the 69-35 win.
The Horses were led by Landen Pearson with 20 points followed by B.J. Bennett with 9, Aaron Mathews with 8, and Jymiek Sampson with 7. The Spartans were led by Dashawn McKoy with 10 points.
The Horses will play for the tournament championship tomorrow night (2/11/20) against Hobbton Middle School. The game will be at approximately 5:00 PM at the Midway Middle School gym.
